site.title: Somerset Strikers Cricket Club
site.description: Somerset West's newest youth and junior cricket club. Join now.

home.intro: Somerset Strikers is a new youth and junior cricket club in Somerset West, South Africa. Our focus is to provide practice, game time, and Western Province Youth League cricket matches to young cricketers in an inclusive, safe, constructive, and competitive environment.

404.intro: Well, well, well, what do we have here? A 404 page, that's what. It's a curious thing, really - you're looking for something, but it's not quite where you thought it would be. Reminds me of a time when a batsman misjudged a delivery and was bowled clean through the gate. But fear not, my friend, we'll get you back on track in no time. It's just a matter of finding the right path, like a well-placed cover drive. So, take a moment to regroup, gather your thoughts, and let's work together to find the right way forward. After all, in the game of life, there's always another innings. Let's make this one count.

contact-us.intro: You can contact us via email or follow us on social media for regular updates. Please remember we are a volunteer team with jobs and families of our own. We will do our best to respond to you.

join.title: Joining Somerset Strikers
join.intro: The easiest way to join is to attend one of our practice sessions and see what Somerset Strikers is all about. You can then sign up as a member.

practice.title: Practice
practice.intro: We practice on Friday afternoon at Beaumont Primary School, Somerset West.

play.title: Play
play.intro: On most Saturdays during the season we play Western Province Youth League matches. We also play tournaments and arrange ad-hoc matches against other cricket clubs and schools.

brand.title: Our Brand
brand.intro: We respect our brand and care about how it is used. If you are interested in using our brand, logo, and other assets please do not edit them. If you use our branding we would appreciate you letting us know. The brand, logo, and other assets are owned by the Somerset Strikers Cricket Club.
brand.thank-you: Thank you to Terblanche Fourie for creating the logo.
